intro: Klasea khuzistanica, commonly known as the Khuzistan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western regions of Iran. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
